pkgmetadata.longdescription: Robust Model-Based Clustering // Performs robust cluster analysis allowing for outliers and noise that cannot be fitted by any cluster. The data are modelled by a mixture of Gaussian distributions and a noise component, which is an improper uniform distribution covering the whole Euclidean space. Parameters are estimated by (pseudo) maximum likelihood. This is fitted by a EM-type algorithm. See Coretto and Hennig (2016) doi:10.1080/01621459.2015.1100996, and Coretto and Hennig (2017) http://jmlr.org/papers/v18/16-382.html.
